style.name: wxHL_ALIGN_LEFT
style.description: Align the text to the left.

style.name: wxHL_ALIGN_RIGHT
style.description: Align the text to the right. This style is not supported under Windows XP but is supported under all the other Windows versions.

style.name: wxHL_ALIGN_CENTRE
style.description: Center the text (horizontally). This style is not supported by the native MSW implementation used under Windows XP and later.

style.name: wxHL_CONTEXTMENU
style.description: Pop up a context menu when the hyperlink is right-clicked. The context menu contains a "Copy URL" menu item which is automatically handled by the hyperlink and which just copies in the clipboard the URL (not the label) of the control.

event.name: EVT_HYPERLINK
event.description: The hyperlink was (left) clicked. If this event is not handled in user's code (or it's skipped; see wxEvent::Skip), then a call to wxLaunchDefaultBrowser is done with the hyperlink's URL.
